content:
In this work, for preparation of [Li2Zn2(bpy)­(ndc)3] (NIIC-30­(Ph)), we used a structural analogue of terephthalic acid, naphthalene-1,4-dicarboxylic acid (H2ndc). To determine the optimal synthesis conditions, the concentrations of H2ndc, bpy, and acetonitrile were varied, as well as the synthesis temperature. Interestingly, framework NIIC-30­(Ph) was not obtained starting from any Li and Zn salt mixtures except using a heterometallic molecular complex. At temperatures below 100 °C, only a gelatinous precipitate was observed; at higher temperatures, an amorphous precipitate appeared. The best yield 73% was obtained at 130 °C with a 6-fold excess of H2ndc, a 3-fold excess of bpy, and a ratio of DMF/acetonitrile = 1:3. The addition of naphthalene-1,4-dicarboxylic acid in the solid form instead of its solution also contributes to an increase in the yield; apparently, this is due to a gradual increase in the concentration of acid in the solution during the synthesis process.

Experimental SectionSynthesis of [Li<sub>2</sub>Zn<sub>2</sub>(py)<sub>2</sub>(piv)<sub>6</sub>]

The heterometallic complex was obtained according to a previously published technique.

Synthesis of [Li<sub>2</sub>Zn<sub>2</sub>(bpy)­(ndc)<sub>3</sub>]·1.5DMF (NIIC-30­(Ph)·DMF)

[Li2Zn2(py)2(piv)6] (20 mg, 0.0235 mmol) was dissolved in 0.5 mL of DMF. Then, 0.140 mL of bpy in DMF (11 mg, 0.07 mmol) was added. The solid sample of naphthalene-1,4-dicarboxylic acid (31 mg, 0.141 mmol) and 0.5 mL of DMF were added to the obtained solution. The total reaction volume was adjusted to 4 mL by the addition of acetonitrile. The resulting mixture was sealed in a glass tube and heated at 130 °C for 48 h. Yellow-brown transparent crystals were filtered off and dried in air (yield 18 mg, 0.0171 mmol, 73% based on the starting complex). Anal (%). Found: C, 57.3; H, 3.6; N, 4.7. Calculated for C50.5H36.5Li2N3.5O13.5Zn2: C, 57.6; H, 3.5; N, 4.65. IR (KBr, cm–1): 1675 s, 1615 s, 1555 s, 1507 m, 1465 s, 1416 s, 1356 s, 1254 s, 1211 m, 1156 m, 1066 m, 1030 w, 976 w, 867 w, 825 s, 801 s, 735 w, 668 m, 643 m, 571 s, 475 s.

Synthesis of Guest-Exchanged Samples

For synthesis of [Li2Zn2(bpy)­(ndc)3]·2.5C6H6 (NIIC-30­(Ph)·benzene), as-synthesized [Li2Zn2(bpy)­(ndc)3]·1.5DMF (NIIC-30­(Ph)·DMF) (50 mg, 0.047 mmol) was soaked in 1 mL of benzene for 3 days. Obtained crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction were used to determine benzene molecule positions. Anal (%). Found: C, 64.7; H, 3.7; N, 2.4. Calculated for C61H41Li2N2O12Zn2: C, 64.3; H, 3.6; N, 2.45. For synthesis of [Li2Zn2(bpy)­(ndc)3]·2.2C8H10 (NIIC-30­(Ph)·xylene), fresh crystals of NIIC-30­(Ph)·DMF (50 mg, 0.047 mmol) were soaked in the corresponding xylene solution (1 mL) for 3 days. Obtained crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction were used to determine xylene molecule positions or used for luminescence investigation (see the SI). Structural integrity after inclusion was supported with PXRD data for each sample (Figure S7). NIIC-30­(Ph)· o -xylene: Anal (%). Found: C, 65.0; H, 4.15; N, 2.3. Calculated for C64.6H48Li2N2O12Zn2: C, 65.26; H, 4.07; N, 2.36; NIIC-30­(Ph)· m -xylene: Anal (%). Found: C, 64.9; H, 4.1; N, 2.3. Calculated for C64.6H48Li2N2O12Zn2: C, 65.26; H, 4.07; N, 2.36; NIIC-30­(Ph)· p -xylene: Anal (%). Found: C, 65.1; H, 4.05; N, 2.35. Calculated for C64.6H48Li2N2O12Zn2: C, 65.26; H, 4.07; N, 2.36.

In this work, for preparation of [Li2Zn2(bpy)(ndc)3] (NIIC-30(Ph)), we used a structural analogue of terephthalic acid, naphthalene-1,4-dicarboxylic acid (H2ndc). To determine the optimal synthesis conditions, the concentrations of H2ndc, bpy, and acetonitrile were varied, as well as the synthesis temperature. Interestingly, framework NIIC-30(Ph) was not obtained starting from any Li and Zn salt mixtures except using a heterometallic molecular complex. At temperatures below 100 °C, only a gelatinous precipitate was observed; at higher temperatures, an amorphous precipitate appeared. The best yield 73% was obtained at 130 °C with a 6-fold excess of H2ndc, a 3-fold excess of bpy, and a ratio of DMF/acetonitrile = 1:3. The addition of naphthalene-1,4-dicarboxylic acid in the solid form instead of its solution also contributes to an increase in the yield; apparently, this is due to a gradual increase in the concentration of acid in the solution during the synthesis process.

Experimental Section

Synthesis of [Li2Zn2(py)2(piv)6]

The heterometallic complex was obtained according to a previously published technique. 

Synthesis of [Li2Zn2(bpy)(ndc)3]⋅1.5DMF (NIIC-30(Ph)⋅DMF)

The solid sample of naphthalene-1,4-dicarboxylic acid (31 mg, 0.141 mmol) and 0.5 mL of DMF were added to the obtained solution. The total reaction volume was adjusted to 4 mL by the addition of acetonitrile. The resulting mixture was sealed in a glass tube and heated at 130 °C for 48 h. Yellow-brown transparent crystals were filtered off and dried in air (yield 18 mg, 0.0171 mmol, 73% based on the starting complex). Anal (%). Found: C, 57.3; H, 3.6; N, 4.7. Calculated for C61H41Li2N2O12Zn2: C, 64.3; H, 3.6; N, 2.45. For synthesis of [Li2Zn2(bpy)(ndc)3]⋅2.2C8H10 (NIIC-30(Ph)⋅xylene), fresh crystals of NIIC-30(Ph)⋅DMF (50 mg, 0.047 mmol) were soaked in the corresponding xylene solution (1 mL) for 3 days. Obtained crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction were used to determine xylene molecule positions or used for luminescence investigation (see the SI). Structural integrity after inclusion was supported with PXRD data for each sample (Figure S7). NIIC-30(Ph)⋅  o  -xylene: Anal (%). Found: C, 65.0; H, 4.15; N, 2.3. Calculated for C64.6H48Li2N2O12Zn2: C, 65.26; H, 4.07; N, 2.36; NIIC-30(Ph)⋅  m  -xylene: Anal (%). Found: C, 64.9; H, 4.1; N, 2.3.
